JAY VEE FRAY WON BY
VISITING QUINT 26-20

Intercollegiate Schedule

ii

An exciting preliminary to a thrilling main event was the Jayvee basketball game which pitted the Blue
Jays Junior Varsity against St.
Johns'. A close fray all the way, the
Johnnies pulled away toward the end
to come out on top by a 26-20 score.
Getting off to an even start, both
piled
up an early total

fives

of six points. At half time the
score showed the visitors on top by
virtue of one free throw with a 13-12
count. However,,,ihe half-time rest did
the Johnnies good, and they gained
a five-point lead, as Weisheit and
Hill came through with fieldgoals to
make the score 19-14. The Johnnies
continued on the offense and'ran their
lead up to ten points.
However, the Blue Jays put on a
belated attack and closed up the gap.
Bitsack and Butt led the offense and
quickly scored three goals between
them. However, before the Jays had
time to get set for another onslaught,
the final gun went off and closed the
game at 26-20.

An exciting preliminary to a thrilling main event was the Jayvee basketball game which pitted the Blue
Jays Junior Varsity against St.
Johns'. A close fray all the way, the
Johnnies pulled away toward the end
to come out on top by a 26-20 score.
Getting off to an even start, both
piled
up an early total

fives

of six points. At half time the
score showed the visitors on top by
virtue of one free throw with a 13-12
count. However,,,ihe half-time rest did
the Johnnies good, and they gained
a five-point lead, as Weisheit and
Hill came through with fieldgoals to
make the score 19-14. The Johnnies
continued on the offense and'ran their
lead up to ten points.
However, the Blue Jays put on a
belated attack and closed up the gap.
Bitsack and Butt led the offense and
quickly scored three goals between
them. However, before the Jays had
time to get set for another onslaught,
the final gun went off and closed the
game at 26-20.

Now Sterling Professor
Now a Stetling professor of history at Yale, Dr. Notestein was active in the state department during
the world war, serving on the American Committee to negotiate peace in
Paris in 1919. He was appointed to
the British Commission on the House
of Commons Records ih 1929, and has
been professor of history at three
universities. Dr. Notestein is the
author and co-author of many books
on seventeenth century social and
politicaVlife in England.

of Stuart reign in England, Dr. Notestein has illuminated some of the

of Commons of that period. This is
